result.execSummary:
The defendant Ray Charles Holman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ray Charles Holman

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ray Charles Holman in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Ray Charles Holman in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Griffin).    
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED and read in.  As to COUNT 1:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  State has complied with victim rights' notification.  Court ordered restitution set at $0.  


Court sentenced defendant to pay a FINE of $600.00  PLUS all costs, penalties and surcharges as a condition of probation (condition of ES if revoked).  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Court ordered Intoxicated Driver Assessment; form filed; copy to defendant.
Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for 2 years.
Court ordered ignition interlock for 1 year, consecutive to revocation.


The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 54 months, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 30 months with credit for 93 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 months.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 4 years with the following conditions: 
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*Pay fine in 14CT2092.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge as a condition of probation.  If revoked, to be collected by the DOC out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- If REVOKED: Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program but DOES qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1/2 initial confinement.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

**If revoked, all Probation conditions shall revert to ES conditions.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCEING IN BRANCH 26.

Defendant Ray Charles Holman in court (bull pen). Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court.  Defendant Ray Charles Holman in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter in court, defendant Ray Charles Holman not in court, in custody.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ray Charles Holman in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Ray Charles Holman in custody.  Ron Dague for James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No driving without a valid license.  Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by SCRAM and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ray Charles Holman in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Ray Charles Holman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
